meanings.definition: A person who designs or works with typography.
meanings.sent1: The typographs carefully selected the fonts for the new book cover.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to become a skilled typographs in the publishing industry.
meanings.sent3: The typographs joked that their favorite font was 'Comic Sans'.
meanings.sent4: His creativity as a typographs painted words on the page like an artist.
meanings.sent5: The typographs' keen eye for design made the text come alive on the poster.

meanings.definition: The art or process of printing with type.
meanings.sent1: Learning about typographs involves understanding different printing techniques.
meanings.sent2: The history of typographs dates back to the invention of the printing press.
meanings.sent3: In the world of typographs, every letter tells a story on the page.
meanings.sent4: The typographs' precision in printing created crisp and clear text.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of typographs lies in the intricate details of each printed letter.

meanings.definition: The arrangement and appearance of printed matter.
meanings.sent1: The typographs focused on the layout to ensure readability of the magazine.
meanings.sent2: Her attention to detail in typographs enhanced the overall look of the brochure.
meanings.sent3: The typographs played with different alignments to create a visually appealing flyer.
meanings.sent4: The typographs' skill in composition transformed the text into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: Each project challenged the typographs to find the perfect balance in design.
